sentences.sContent: So the people of the manor lived peacefully, and Lizette’s governess taught her painting and piano and herbalism and manners, and her Grandfather taught her romping and riding and forestry.
sentences.sContent_eng: So the people of the manor lived peacefully, and Lizette’s governess taught her painting and piano and herbalism and manners, and her Grandfather taught her romping and riding and forestry.
sentences.sCn: 于是人们在庄园里过着安静祥和的生活。 莉莎特的家庭女教师教她绘画、钢琴、草药和礼仪，祖父则教她玩耍、骑术以及森林学。

sentences.sContent: Readers and some critics were scandalised by the story of a young, plain governess who falls in love with her Byronic employer, unaware that he already has a mad wife incarcerated in the attic.
sentences.sContent_eng: Readers and some critics were scandalised by the story of a young, plain governess who falls in love with her Byronic employer, unaware that he already has a mad wife incarcerated in the attic.
sentences.sCn: 读者和一些评论家都对书中的故事感到震惊，在书中一个年轻、普通的女家庭教师爱上了她傲慢的雇主，却不知道他有一个疯妻子被关在阁楼里。

sentences.sContent: The 1847 Victorian novel "Jane Eyre," of course, tells the epic love story of a governess and her master, Edward Rochester.
sentences.sContent_eng: The 1847 Victorian novel "Jane Eyre," of course, tells the epic love story of a governess and her master, Edward Rochester.
sentences.sCn: 大家都知道，这部1847年维多利亚时代的小说《简爱》讲述的是一个家庭教师和她的主人爱德华·罗彻斯特之间的爱情故事。

trans.tranOther: a female teacher in the past, who lived with a rich family and taught their children at home
